author: A_Brickset_user
title: Where's the minifigure?
review: This set wouldn't be so bad if it had a minifigure, but it's one of those strange little sets that didn't have one.  The design is pretty basic and couldn't really be improved on, but I would recommend putting a flat plate with a number on it like many racecars have.  Real suspension might be asking too much but it wouldn't hurt.  I own it but can't say it's a must-have set.

author: Blade
title: Lill' Red
review:
This race car has similar features to 1610 which i recently reviewed. This is another one of those models that have no mini-fig, look really tiny and should be part of some promotion.

There really isn't much to say, I mean its a red race car with a touch of yellow and black, which looks nice, a racing frame and a spoiler on a hinge so you can choose the best angle. Also the spoiler is made from grill pieces.

Overall it's a nice little cheapy. An average 5/10. Don't go out of your way for it like 1631 but if you come across it, it makes a nice addition for any collector or player looking for more vehicles for their figs.

author: AETerry
title: Race Car Review
review:
This was one of a few sets put out that didn't come with a minifigure, which is alright if you've got a plethora of minifigures but no vehicles for them to go with.

 

It is indeed a solid little design, about the only thing I'd have differently is put a number plate for designation on it.
